duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and execute comprehensive research strategies to lead state-of-the-art and innovative cardiovascular research within the Center for Cardiovascular Analytics, Research and Data Science (CARDS).

Partner with the larger Providence system and collaborate with external investigators to independently conduct scientific research in support of ongoing transformation or innovation efforts in cardiovascular research.
Act as an independent investigator or co-investigator on health services research projects, develop partnerships, and acquire grant or sponsor funding to support projects.
Manage projects to ensure completion on time and budget and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements governing research.
Disseminate results internally to leadership and other Providence researchers and externally through participation in scientific meetings and peer-reviewed publications.
Collaborate with clinical, operational, and research leaders within the Heart Institute and the Providence Research Network Hub.
Lead research and research teams that leverage technologies in support of improved evaluation and treatment of various cardiovascular conditions.
Provide leadership, training, and strategic insight for an established cardiovascular research center.
Develop methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for solving research problems and answering research questions.
Manage project budgets to accomplish stated objectives and keep projects within scope of available resources.

Responsible for obtaining internal or external funding to implement research project or study in conjunction with Medical Director and CARDS Director and serve as principal investigator on grant applications.

education_certification.credential: PhD, ScD, DrPH in Health Services, Data Science, Public Health, Epidemiology, Laboratory Science or related medical field
